subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Striker Samuel Eto’o tied the career record for the most African Cup of Nations goals with 14 when he scored on a penalty kick as Cameroon defeated Zambia, 5-1, in Kumasi, Ghana. Eto’o tied the record set by the former Ivory Coast forward Laurent Pokou. In Saturday’s other game in Kumasi, Mohamed Aboutreika scored twice in Egypt’s 3-0 victory over Sudan.
